nodes.title: Understand AWS services
nodes.desc: Familiarize yourself with the various services offered by AWS, including computing, storage, databases, analytics, machine learning, and more. [AWS Services](https://aws.amazon.com/products/)

nodes.title: Set up an AWS account
nodes.desc: Create an account on the AWS website and set up your credentials, including your access keys and secret keys. [AWS Account Setup](https://aws.amazon.com/getting-started/)

nodes.title: Monitor and troubleshoot
nodes.desc: Use AWS services such as CloudWatch, X-Ray, and CloudTrail to monitor and troubleshoot your applications. [AWS Monitoring and Troubleshooting](https://aws.amazon.com/products/monitoring-troubleshooting/)

nodes.title: Optimize costs
nodes.desc: Use AWS services such as Cost Explorer, Budgets, and Reserved Instances to optimize your costs. [AWS Cost Optimization](https://aws.amazon.com/products/cost-optimization/)

nodes.title: Migrate to AWS
nodes.desc: Migrate your applications and data to AWS using services such as AWS Migration Hub, Database Migration Service (DMS), and Server Migration Service (SMS). [AWS Migration](https://aws.amazon.com/products/migration/)

nodes.title: Use AWS CLI
nodes.desc: Use the AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) to manage your AWS resources from the command line. [AWS CLI](https://aws.amazon.com/cli/)

nodes.title: Use AWS SDKs
nodes.desc: Use the AWS Software Development Kits (SDKs) to manage your AWS resources from your applications. [AWS SDKs](https://aws.amazon.com/sdk/)

nodes.title: Learn about AWS certifications
nodes.desc: Familiarize yourself with the various AWS certifications available, including the AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner and AWS Certified Solutions Architect. [AWS Certifications](https://aws.amazon.com/certification/)

nodes.title: Prepare for AWS exams
nodes.desc: Prepare for AWS exams using study materials such as the AWS Exam Guide and AWS Training and Certification. [AWS Exam Preparation](https://aws.amazon.com/training-and-certification/)

nodes.title: Choose an AWS region
nodes.desc: Select a region that is closest to your users or meets your specific requirements, such as data sovereignty or latency. [AWS Regions](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/)

nodes.title: Learn about AWS IAM
nodes.desc: Understand the Identity and Access Management (IAM) service, which enables you to manage access to your AWS resources. [AWS IAM](https://aws.amazon.com/iam/)

nodes.title: Understand AWS security
nodes.desc: Familiarize yourself with the security features and best practices for securing your AWS resources, including encryption, firewalls, and access controls. [AWS Security](https://aws.amazon.com/security/)

nodes.title: Learn about AWS storage options
nodes.desc: Understand the different storage options available on AWS, including S3, EBS, and Elastic File System (EFS). [AWS Storage](https://aws.amazon.com/products/storage/)

nodes.title: Learn about AWS databases
nodes.desc: Familiarize yourself with the various database options available on AWS, including RDS, DynamoDB, and DocumentDB. [AWS Databases](https://aws.amazon.com/products/databases/)

nodes.title: Learn about AWS analytics
nodes.desc: Understand the various analytics services available on AWS, including Redshift, QuickSight, and Lake Formation. [AWS Analytics](https://aws.amazon.com/products/analytics/)

nodes.title: Learn about AWS machine learning
nodes.desc: Familiarize yourself with the machine learning services available on AWS, including SageMaker, Rekognition, and Comprehend. [AWS Machine Learning](https://aws.amazon.com/products/machine-learning/)

nodes.title: Deploy a web application
nodes.desc: Deploy a web application on AWS using services such as Elastic Beanstalk, CloudFormation, or Elastic Container Service (ECS). [AWS Web Application Deployment](https://aws.amazon.com/getting-started/tutorials/deploy-web-app/)
